instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
Hi,

Need help with a 820-00165 board. Green light and then goes amber but no fan spin. I checked all power rails and found PP5V_S4RS3 missing. I followed louis’ video [MEDIA=vimeo]315832835[/MEDIA] and as correctly pointed out PM_SLP_S4_L missing. Checked the link from R6125 and R6012 to test point and test point to R1548 and they are just fine. So what next. Is it the bios or CPU. Any further suggestions..

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Do not suspect BIOS, untill power on sequence is completed.
Do you get 3V3_S5/SUS?

Post PM_BATLOW_L, PM_DSW_PWRGD, PCH_DSWVRMEN, PM_RSMRST_L and PM_PWRBTN_L.
Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L at same time.

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
3V3_S5 – 3.3 v
3V3_SUS – 3.3v
PM_BATLOW_L – 2.07v
PM_DSW_PWRGD – 3.41v
PCH_DSWVRMEN – 3.3 v
PM_RSMRST_L – 2.3 mv
PM_PWRBTN_L – 1.4 v
Sorry i don't have a scope and can't check for pulse at  PM_PWRBTN_L

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
You don't need an o-scope to see if a voltage tries to appear, or not.
However, is not the case here, as you are missing previous signals required.

Check for corrosion around U8130.
Be sure R8133 is good.

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message: Checked U8130 and seems clean. R8133 measures 99.2k. This board has no history of water damage and is pretty clean.

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
Check if PM_RSMRST_L goes high removing U8130.
If yes, change it...

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message: Removed U8130 and  PM_RSMRST_L still shows 720 mv and PPBUS_G3H also dropped to 1.41v.

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
U8130 cannot drop PPBUS_G3H.
Check what happen with this voltage...

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
Will need help sorting this. 
F7140 - 1.4v on both sides.
R7185 - 16.5v on pin 1 and  6.36v on pin2.
R7186 - 6.36v on pin1 and 3.7mv on pin2.
Looking for further guidance.

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
If you had 3V3_S5 in the first post, PPBUS_G3H was good.
Something happened when you've changed the U8130.

Check for short on all big coils.
Post diode mode to ground on PPBUS_G3H.
And basic voltages for U7100; pins 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27.

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message: Please correct me if I am wrong.. you want the above readings with U8130 off the board or should I solder it back on the board and then give you the readings. This reading of PPBUS_G3H is with U8130 off the board.I have not changed U8130. I removed U8130 and checked PM_RSMRST_L for high as instructed and I happened to check PPBUS_G3H and it showed 1.4v. Sorry for the long post but I am a little confused here....

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
No matters U8130 is soldered, or not.
You must get PPBUS_G3H in both cases...

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
Reading as requested with U8130 not soldered.

Check for short on all big coils – No short on any coils.
Post diode mode to ground on PPBUS_G3H. – 2.378
And basic voltages for U7100;

pins
1 - 3.9mv
2 - 16.29v
3 - 4.28v
9 - 0.38mv
12 - 3.41v
13 - 2.95v
14 - 3.13v
15 - 57.3mv
17 - 1.41v
19 - 5.1v
20 - 5.1v
27 – 16.1v

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
Something happened when you've removed U8130.
It is far away of U7100, I have no idea what else you've touched.

Change C7125 and Q7130.

"diode mode to ground on PPBUS_G3H. – 2.378"
This doesn't look like diode mode.
Keep in mind, ALWAYS measure diode mode with red probe on ground.
Sometime need to invert the leads too.
You should get 0.100-150 and OL for black on ground.

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message: Diode mode red to ground i get 0.137 and black to ground i get 2.378.

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
"Change C7125 and Q7130."
???

Also check all traces and solders around U7100.

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message: Replaced Q7130 and I got 3.9v on F7140 and no fan spin. Second time i switched on i get a fan spin. I installed the heat sink and powered up again. Fan spin and C7370 just blew up. Any checks before i replace it and switch on.

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
Probably Q7130 shorted between R7120 and L7130.
Replace C7125 and assure good solders at U7100.

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message: Replaced C7370 and C7125. U7100 traces seem to be visually all fine. Resoldered U7100. Should i change Q7130 again before I power on?

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
Didn't check if is shorted???
R7120 beeps with L7130?

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message: Yes i did check Q7130 shorted to ground and it was not. R7120 no beep with L7130. I am a rookie at macboard repairing and wanted to be sure before i power it. So can i safely power it now.

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message: Yes, in this case.

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
Powered on but no fan spin and PPBUS_G3H missing. Changed Q7130 and still missing. So i decided to check all voltages again and 3V3_SUS also missing.

PPBUS_G3H - 120 mv

3V3_S5 – 3.3 v
3V3_SUS – 1.6 mv
PM_BATLOW_L – 586 mv
PM_DSW_PWRGD – 3.4v
PCH_DSWVRMEN – 3.1v
PM_RSMRST_L – 2.3 mv
PM_PWRBTN_L – 1.4 v

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
I'm wonder why do you check secondary voltages derived from PPBUS_G3H, when this is missing...

Post U7100 basic voltages; pins 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27.

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
"19 -743mv
20 -450 mv"
Be sure no short there and change U7100; maybe R7101 too.

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message: Changed U7100 and now getting 5.1v on 19 and 20. R7101 seems ok at 4.8 Ohms. Still no fan spin.

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
Do you get PPBUS_G3H now???
Is so hard to get relevant information from you...

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message: Please bear with me.. I am new to this and will catch up fast..  PPBUS_G3H still missing.

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message: Post again U7100 mentioned pin voltages.

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message: Checking pin voltages for U7100 and suddenly charger light goes off. Now no green or amber light. Changed u7100 but still no green light. Seems i screwed up but i am sure there was no short while checking. Should i give up on this one or is there hope?

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
We need some voltages from the board.
Also check for short on big coils; L7130 first.

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message: Yes. There is a short on L7130. No short on any other coil.

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
Post the exact ohm value.
Compare reading with all other big coils.

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
L7030 to Ground – 00.40 Ohms
L7520 to Ground – 900K ohms and keeps dropping
L7560 to Ground – 900K ohms and keeps dropping
L7430 to Ground – 900K ohms and keeps dropping
L7630 to Ground – 203.5ohms
L3095 to Ground – 1.01 M ohms and keeps dropping
L7701 to Ground – 600K ohms and keeps dropping
L7320 to Ground – 24.80 ohms
L7310 to Ground – 24.80 ohms

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
"L7030 to Ground – 00.40 Ohms"
Do you mean 400 miliohm?
That is pure short and seems to be safe to inject voltage.
1-2V should be good enough to find the culprit; maybe just a capacitor.

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message: Applied 2v and it draws 5.2 amp current but nothing blows up or heats up. Checked on both sides of the board. Nothing..

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
Do you have 5A lab PSU?
In such case, it doesn't inject anything; in fact, got blocked.
Lower the voltage to maintain curent under PSU limit.

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message: Just removed Q7130 and shorting gone. Will replace and check and revert.

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message: Replaced Q7130 and I have 8.6v on F7140. Fan spins stops and spins again after a few seconds and stops. Any ideas what next.

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
Do you get VCORE?
Check all coils voltage and pages 57/58.

Try to start in SMC bypass also.

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
PP1V8_S3 - 0v
PP1V05_SUS - 1.05v
PP1V5_S0 - 0v
PP3V3_SUS - 3.3v
PP3V3_S4 - 0.3v
PP3V3_S3 - 0.6v
PP5V_S0 - 0v
I think i need to check all the base voltages again. Will post the results later.

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
3V3_S5 – 3.3 v
3V3_SUS – 3.3v
PM_BATLOW_L – 3.1v
PM_DSW_PWRGD – 3.41v
PCH_DSWVRMEN – 3.5 v
PM_RSMRST_L – 2.9 v
PM_PWRBTN_L – 3.3 v

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
No need to check any S3/0 voltage, as you don't get L7520 voltage (5V).

Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L.

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
Sorry but you'll have to guide me thru this one.. please tell me the procedure. How do i trigger  SMC_ONOFF_L and can i check for drop pulse with a multi meter?
 I just checked voltage on L7520 when i power on. it gives me 5.1v when fan spins and then drops again 5.1v fan spins and drops. 
SMC_ONOFF_L has 3.41v.

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
As you must work with board alone on the desk, R5115/16 pads can be used instead od power button.
In fact, solder a wire on a convenient point of SMC_ONOFF_L and temporary touch the ground, simulating power button action.
Voltmeter should note PM_PWRBTN_L dropping from 3V to 0V at same time.

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message: Appreciate you hand holding me thru this one... Did as instructed and  PM_PWRBTN_L  drops from 3.4v to 0v. Fan spins and stops.

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
If fan spins, this means the board tries to start at least.
Check if voltage appears on all big coils at that time.
Also try to start in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message: Like i mentioned in my earlier post ....  I just checked voltage on L7520 when i power on. it gives me 5.1v when fan spins and then drops again 5.1v fan spins and drops.

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
"Check if voltage appears [U][B]on all big coils[/B][/U] at that time."
Did you really check for pulse at ALL big coils???

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
L7130 - 8.59v steady
L7520 - 5.1v and drops
L7560 - 3.3v steady
L7430 - 1.21v and drops
L7630 - 1.05v and drops
L7310 - 1.8v and drops
L7320 - 1.8v and drops
SMC bypass - Fan spins, all voltages steady and i get display too.  What next..

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
That means you have problem with some SMC sensor level.
Check the pages 41/42.

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message: Removed and re soldered U7100 and I have a perfect working board. Boots up and working fine on adapter but randomly shuts down when running on battery. Sometimes works for 5 minutes and sometimes just shuts down before the boot process completes. No problems when it's running on adapter.  Any ideas what i should check?

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message: First step, try known good battery.

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message: Battery change Done. SMC Reset done. PRAM reset done.

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message: Start in SMC bypass, disconnect charger and check if still turns off with battery alone.

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message: How can i confirm if it has started in smc bypass. I keep the power button pressed for 10 seconds but it boots up and behaves like it is normal. I read it becomes slow but i don't feel any difference.

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message: Fan must start with full speed in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message: This one is driving me crazy... I keep the power button pressed for 10 - 15 seconds but find no change in fan speed. I am not sure if i managed to do a smc bypass. I still shuts down on battery. will run for maybe a few minutes. Any other way to do a smc bypass?

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message: Try first without battery, to be sure if goes in SMC bypass mode correctly.

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message: Without battery, with battery but still no luck. Fan spins at about 2500 RPM. Let me clarify one thing... I keep the power button pressed for 10 -20 seconds to get in to SMC bypass mode. Is that the correct and only way? Anything else i can check for this random shutdown on battery?

threads.title: MacBook A1466 2015 820-00165 No Fan Spin.
threads.message: If you really enter to SMC bypass, fan must start at max speed.
